question: Which of the following define Biofilms?
option1: Colour films used by biologists to photograph living organisms
option2: photomicrographs of microorganisms from various habitats
option3: accumulations of microorganisms at surfaces such as those of a rock, a tooth or an oil droplet
option4: photographic films made through fermentation processes of certain industrial microorganisms
answer: accumulations of microorganisms at surfaces such as those of a rock, a tooth or an oil droplet
explanation: A biofilm comprises any syntrophic consortium of microorganisms in which cells stick to each other and often also to a surface. These adherent cells become embedded within a slimy extracellular matrix that is composed of extracellular polymeric substances. Microorganisms that form biofilms include bacteria, fungi and protists. One common example of a biofilm dental plaque, a slimy buildup of bacteria that forms on the surfaces of teeth.
